abstract: Jefferson County reached an agreement to refinance most of the debt that led to its $4.2 billion municipal bankruptcy, the largest such filing in United States history.
snippet: Jefferson County reached an agreement to refinance most of the debt that led to its $4.2 billion municipal bankruptcy, the largest such filing in United States history.
lead_paragraph: Jefferson County, Ala., took a big step toward resolving its historic bankruptcy case on Tuesday, saying it had reached an agreement to refinance most of the debt at the heart of its financial breakdown.

headline.main: A County in Alabama Strikes a Bankruptcy Deal
headline.print_headline: A County in Alabama Strikes a Bankruptcy Deal
